channel.title: Parenting and the Internet
channel.description: Advice and recsources for parents of online children.
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2007 Todd Curtis, All Rights Reserved
channel.itunes:subtitle: Advice and resources for parents of online children.
channel.itunes:summary: The podcast provides timely advice and a variety of useful resources for parents who have children that use the Internet and want to have more control over the situation. This podcast is for parents who know nothing about computers or parents who are experts at going online. You can bet that your kids are always willing to try something new and different online. It is up to you to stay on top of things.

item.title: What You Need to Know About Filtering
item.itunes:author: Dr. Todd Curtis
item.itunes:subtitle: An explanation of what online filters do and how they can protect your family
item.itunes:summary: In this show, Dr. Curtis describes an online filter, how it is used, and how parents can use it to protect their children. He also explains how to change the filter level on the search engines from Google, Yahoo!, and Microsoft's Live Search.
item.description: In this show, Dr. Curtis describes an online filter, how it is used, and how parents can use it to protect their children. He also explains how to change the filter level on the search engines from Google, Yahoo!, and Microsoft's Live Search.
item.itunes:keywords: online, child, internet, filter, search, engine, pornography, simpson, bart, homer, lisa, marge, maggie
item.author: feedback@speedbrake.com (Dr. Todd Curtis)

item.title: How to Give Your Online Filter the Simpson Test
item.itunes:author: Dr. Todd Curtis
item.itunes:subtitle: Using search engines to check your online filter's effectiveness
item.itunes:summary: In this show, Dr. Curtis provides step-by-step instructions for testing the effectiveness of your family's online filter. The podcast also provides link for additional filtering resources.
item.description: In this show, Dr. Curtis provides step-by-step instructions for tesing the effectiveness of your family's online filter.

item.title: The Internet Never Forgets
item.itunes:author: Dr. Todd Curtis
item.itunes:subtitle: Why you should be concerned about how long your child's online actions may linger online
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Curtis reviews the recent scandal involving the mayor of Detroit, the consequences of inappropriate use of the Internet, and the lessons this event may have for the online lives of your children.
item.description: Dr. Curtis reviews the recent scandal involving the mayor of Detroit, the consequences of inappropriate use of the Internet, and the lessons this event may have for the online lives of your children.
item.itunes:keywords: online, child, internet, social, reputation, memory, rules, parent, roles, family
item.author: feedback@speedbrake.com (Dr. Todd Curtis)

item.title: Dealing with a New Kind of Threat - An Adult Who Acts Like Both a Cyberbully and Predator
item.itunes:author: Dr. Todd Curtis
item.itunes:subtitle: The Case of a 13-year Old Sucide Victim and the Role Played by the Internet
item.itunes:summary: A discussion of a case of a 13-year old who committed suicide in part because of the alleged actions of an adult who pretended to be a 16-year old boy in order to gain the trust of the child.
item.description: A discussion of a case of a 13-year old who committed suicide in part because of the alleged actions of an adult who pretended to be a 16-year old boy in order to gain the trust of the child.
item.itunes:keywords: online, child, internet, social, network, myspace, suicide, rules, parent, roles, family
item.author: feedback@speedbrake.com (Dr. Todd Curtis)
